skillTree.localised_description: Since the founding of Bretonnia, the Green Knight has challenged the Questing Knights seeking the Grail.

effects.description: (own armies factionwide)
Character experience gain per turn: +500
Campaign movement range: +100%
Hero self-defence: +100% chance of wounding aggressors
Enemy Hero action success chance: -100%

skillTree.localised_description: The herald of the Green Knight’s arrival, the mist lingers on the battlefield and quickens Bretonnian Steeds.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% for cavalry units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: They may not yet be Knights of the Realm, but the Errantry Knights seek to prove their worth.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +25% for Knights Errant units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘Never to give up the fight until the foe be defeated.’

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for Knight of the Realm units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘A knight shall not flee from the enemy, nor retreat without proper tactical cause.’

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Questing Knights units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lady protects the noble creatures that carry her faithful knights to battle.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% for Pegasus and Royal Pegasus Knights units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Already famously dangerous creatures, the Green Knight’s rage against the invaders of Bretonnia seems to inspire the Hippogryphs to even greater carnage.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Royal Hippogryph Knights units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: To reach the Grail, the Questing Knights must first best the Green Knight in single combat. Only the most skilled will ever have this opportunity.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Grail Knights and Grail Guardians units
	(own armies factionwide)

Melee defence: +3 for Grail Knights and Grail Guardians units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: All knights must fight for the Royarch when commanded. The presence of the Green Knight reminds all of their vows.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Cavalry units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the peasants seek to join the Green Knight in battle.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Infantry units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘Oi, we’ll get ‘em just like when we’ll till the fields!’

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Spearmen-at-Arms, Men-at-Arms (Polearms) and Mounted Yeomen units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘I’ll be polishin’ the lord’s armour for years, turning aside a blow ain’t so different after all.’

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Men-at-Arms with swords units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Even a lowborn peasant, should he perform a sufficiently great deed or task, can be elevated to Knighthood. Perhaps even be noticed by the Green Knight himself…?

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +20% for Foot Squire units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: For the zealous peasantry that follow the Grail Knights, the opportunity to assist the Green Knight, in however small a way, is too great to pass up.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Battle Pilgrims and Grail Reliquae units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: They may not be brave, strong, wise, or skilled; their aim may be poor, their bowstrings frayed, and their arrows splintered, but damned if they’re not excitable.

effects.description:
Range: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Herrimaults and Mounted Yeomen Archers units
	(own armies factionwide)

Missile strength: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Herrimaults and Mounted Yeomen Archers units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘From here we’ll be seein’ the charge of the gallant knights as they break the foe! We’re far better off servin’ back here than on the frontlines.’

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +20% for Trebuchet units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘I’ll be dead but not for the Green Knight appearin’ to turn aside the orc’s blade and relieve his head from his body!’

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for all non-Knight units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: The tales of the Green Knight are told to every Bretonnian, from the lowliest peasant to the mightiest knight.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +100%

skillTree.localised_description: Serving at the Lady’s side, the Green Knight channels her power into every blow.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +40%

skillTree.localised_description: The Questing Knights seek the Grail. Their final test is to defeat the Green Knight in single combat. Few survive this final ordeal.

effects.description: Melee attack: +20

skillTree.localised_description: The Green Knight smashes into the foe, with all the weight and power of a full Bretonnian regiment.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +75%

skillTree.localised_description: Legend holds that Gilles le Breton slew the great red wyrm, Smearghus, by plunging his sword through the creature’s eye.

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +25

skillTree.localised_description: Who are you to face the Green Knight, who has fought every beast and horror imaginable, and triumphed?

effects.description: Hit points: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: The famous declaration of the Green Knight inspires every Bretonnian.

effects.description: Ability: "Call of the Lady"
Ability: "Withstand!"
Character experience gain per turn: +250

skillTree.localised_description: Their burdens lessened, their pains alleviated, their minds eased, the soldiers of Bretonnia travel far and wide in defense of the nation.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10% for armies
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Seeking honor and renown, the knights set to challenging each other to friendly duels.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +250
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Bretonnians, sally forth! We must defend the Kingdom!

effects.description:
Reinforcement range: +50%
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: True paragons of virtue ride forth, inspired by Bretonnia’s most legendary hero.

effects.description:
Lord recruit rank: +3
	(all provinces)

Hero recruit rank: +3
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the naturally weak-minded peasant, normally unsteady of heart and mind, have their resolve strengthened by the Green Knight’s presence.

effects.description:
Control: +2
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Though the nobles are not required to tithe when visiting a brotherhood shrine or temple, the tales of the Green Knight have inspired them to unusual generosity.

effects.description:
Income from all buildings: +25%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lady manifests in many sacred locations throughout Bretonnia, driving evil from the lands.

effects.description:
Corruption: -2
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: In times of war, even the great lords and heroes of Bretonnia will ration supplies (mostly from their servants).

effects.description: (all characters factionwide)

Upkeep: -10% for Lords and Heroes
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: ‘A knight shall not allow himself to be captured alive.’

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +25% for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Blessed by the Lady, the Bretonnian lakes are filled with the purest water, healing the battle wounds of the chivalrous and faithful.

effects.description:
Constant casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Never before has Bretonnia seen such a golden age of progress and chivalry.

effects.description: Research rate: +25

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
